commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults

With latest bandit version, The bandit.yaml is only necessary
for advanced tweaking. We can just use the defaults.

Change-Id: Ib1cb84eb428baa98508e431268fb8bd1bbf2d505
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/07/276507/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = bandit -r oslo_messaging -n5 -p oslo.messaging

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-10-12 10:42:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/0dcdbe6406a744bdb20b462bf3d41680b4b6b045', 'message': "Refactor OCF functions

- Combine heat_engine_ubuntu and heat_engine_centos into single OCF
  script heat-engine
  - Remove unused dependency from /lib/lsb/init-functions and
    /etc/rc.d/init.d/functions
  - Remove start-stop-daemon and daemon to 'su' equivalent to make
    heat-engine script typical to all OpenStack services OCF scripts
- Move port validation *_check_port from all OCF script to OCF library
  (validate_port)
   - ceilometer_agent_central_check_port()
   - ceilometer_alarm_evaluator_check_port()
   - heat_engine_check_port()
   - nova_compute_check_port()
   - write bats unit tests for validate_port
- Remove 'ocf-' from neutron OCF scripts names to make them typical to all
  OpenStack services
  - Rename ocf-neutron-dhcp-agent to neutron-dhcp-agent
  - Rename ocf-neutron-l3-agent to neutron-l3-agent
  - Rename ocf-neutron-ovs-agent to neutron-ovs-agent
- Rename rabbitmq to rabbitmq-server. This removes unneccessary mv in
  debian/rules and fuel-library8.0.spec
- Some minor bash typos and old comments clean-up

Change-Id: Ic4bcecdbc05f6306be63dea211df96a104cb2d36
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Refactor OCF functions

- Move port validation *_check_port from all OCF script to OCF library
  (validate_port)
   - ceilometer_agent_central_check_port()
   - ceilometer_alarm_evaluator_check_port()
   - heat_engine_check_port()
   - nova_compute_check_port()
   - write bats unit tests for validate_port
- Remove 'ocf-' from neutron OCF scripts names to make them typical to all
  OpenStack services
  - Rename ocf-neutron-dhcp-agent to neutron-dhcp-agent
  - Rename ocf-neutron-l3-agent to neutron-l3-agent
  - Rename ocf-neutron-ovs-agent to neutron-ovs-agent
- Some minor bash typos and old comments clean-up

Change-Id: Ic4bcecdbc05f6306be63dea211df96a104cb2d36

commit_message:
Refactor MySQL OCF script

- Add LH/LL variables to all functions for extra logging
- Fix mysql_status to report OCF_NOT_RUNNING when MySQL is stopped
  outside of pacemaker
- Removing sst_in_progress verification from mysql_monitor as it's part
  of mysql_status
- Added default loglevel to mysql_status
- Removed unnecessary update_node_gtid && check_if_reelection_needed
  from mysql_start
- Refactor mysql_stop. Removed custom stop function in favour of
  proc_stop() from ocf-fuel-funcs library

Closes-Bug: 1542256
Change-Id: I4e0d45b9c629c91643fec931be701e13ea5001bb
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1545587

commit_message:
Ignore connection error when testing load balancer

In the integration test with Neutron Load Balancer, we sometimes fail to
connect to the Load Balancer when testing that the stack deployed
successfully. Let's ignore those errors so that we retry for a bit in
case it takes some time to be deployed.

Change-Id: Ic97bd83fe56dc52fb49848d93e40cb57d1550a1f
Closes-Bug: #1545587
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/99/281799/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: r = requests.get(url) except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: # The LB may not be up yet, let's retry continue

commit_message:
scenario001: deploy Glance with RBD backend

* Allow glance.pp to configure RBD backend.
* Switch scenario001 to run Glance with RBD backend.
* Update README with more documentation about Glance backends.

commit_message:
Use eventlet.monkey_patch() before any libs are loaded

Monkeypatching should be before everything, including imports.
This patch ensure eventlet have patched modules before they are loaded
and used.

Change-Id: I6056bdbd20c14e762702ad19c9779a4be79952b8
Closes-Bug: #1545538

deleted_lines: import sysif os.name == 'nt': # eventlet monkey patching causes subprocess.Popen to fail on Windows # when using pipes due to missing non blocking I/O support eventlet.monkey_patch(os=False) else: eventlet.monkey_patch()

parameter to the _get_nb_and_vlan method.

subject: nova-manage: Add hooks for running  data-migration scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 20:30:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4ac00641ec3e5b94166fa570ddf277ad6deee7d1', 'message': 'nova-manage: Add hooks for generating data-migration scripts

As data migration scripts rely on objects loading and saving to do their
work, most of the stuff around it is boilerplate. We added as part of
the OnlineDataMigration class, so with this we hook in the last piece -
generating the actual migration script.

The user will just need to declare a migration as part of the
online_migrations tule on the DbCommands class, and an option will be
generated.

See tests for some simple examples.

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-16 13:46:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7d5069ce20ec0d792a3974b2c53d01ae005cde98', 'message': "nova-manage: Add hooks for running  data-migration scripts

As data migrations can be of arbitrary complexity, it is very difficult
to nail down a framework other than just a method call that does all the
work. We want to be able to control how much work is done during each
run, but that's about it.

After writing a method that does the migrations, optionally limited by
the max_count argument that can be passed in, developers who introduced
the migration  will just need to declare it as part of the
online_migrations tuple on the DbCommands class, and the operators can
simply run a single online_data_migration command to migrate all the
declared migrations.

See tests for some simple examples.

Change-Id: I23810de8fc0d3875daf19af08bc9b57461f177ee
"}]
commit_message:
nova-manage: Add hooks for running  data-migration scripts

As data migrations can be of arbitrary complexity, it is very difficult
to nail down a framework other than just a method call that does all the
work. We want to be able to control how much work is done during each
run, but that's about it.

After writing a method that does the migrations, optionally limited by
the max_count argument that can be passed in, developers who introduced
the migration  will just need to declare it as part of the
online_migrations tuple on the DbCommands class, and the operators can
simply run a single online_data_migration command to migrate all the
declared migrations.

See tests for some simple examples.

Change-Id: I23810de8fc0d3875daf19af08bc9b57461f177ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/278078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class _OnlineMigrationMeta(type): """Metaclass for generating data migration scripts for objects""" def __new__(cls, name, bases, dct): def generate_script(script_name, db_mig_cls): def _migration(self, max_number): admin_context = context.get_admin_context() db_mig_cls.run(admin_context, max_number) dec = args('--max-number', metavar='<number>', dest='max_number', help='Maximum number of %(cls)s entries to consider' % {"cls": db_mig_cls.obj_cls.__name__}) _migration.__name__ = script_name return dec(_migration) migrations = dct.get('online_migrations', ()) for mig_class in migrations: name = "migrate_%s_data" % mig_class.obj_cls.__name__.lower() script = generate_script(name, mig_class) dct[name] = script return type.__new__(cls, name, bases, dct) @six.add_metaclass(_OnlineMigrationMeta)

commit_message:
Allowed to pass SSH credentials as parameters

get_admin_remote, get_node_remote and get_ssh_to_remote
now allow passing SSH login/password as parameters. This
will allow fuel-qa to specify custom username in case
non-root accounts are being used.

Change-Id: I8d4c76f1095b0cd261131c26ed54486ed6f88d87
Blueprint: fuel-nonroot-openstack-nodes

commit_message:
Postpone heavy policy check for ports to later

When a port is validated, we check for the user to be the owner of
corresponding network, among other things. Sadly, this check requires a
plugin call to fetch the network, which goes straight into the database.
Now, if there are multiple ports to validate with current policy, and
the user is not admin, we fetch the network for each port, f.e. making
list operation on ports to scale badly.

To avoid that, we should postpone OwnerCheck (tenant_id) based
validations that rely on foreign keys, tenant_id:%(network:...)s, to as
late as possible. It will make policy checks avoid hitting database in
some cases, like when a port is owned by current user.

Note: the patch excludes regression unit tests to avoid breaking
external plugin repos that rely on base db test classes private methods
like _create_network or _create_router.

See Ic323e148f7d6d333194aa339774afa953b241aa7 for details about possible
third party breakage.

Change-Id: I99e0c4280b06d8ebab0aa8adc497662c995133ad
Closes-Bug: #1513782

subject: Add hostname config type
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 13:59:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/ba0c33434ca1a04eb247ba24db516493b88b3f64', 'message': 'Add hostname config type

Hostnames are often used in config files and they have specific
validation requirements. This change adds a config to validate a
correct hostname are specified in a config file.

A hostname refers to a valid DNS or hostname. It must not be longer than

commit_message:
Add hostname config type

Hostnames are often used in config files and they have specific
validation requirements. This change adds a config to validate a
correct hostname are specified in a config file.

A hostname refers to a valid DNS or hostname. It must not be longer than
253 characters, have a segment greater than 63 characters and start or
end with a hyphen.

Closes-Bug: #1508943
Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ic1028a437aee6076c4b7f437f60bbd209f38a20e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/17/238517/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class Hostname(ConfigType): # Subdomain? def __init__(self): super(Hostname, self).__init__() def __call__(self, value): """Check hostname is valid. Ensures that each segment - Contains at least one character and a maximum of 63 characters - Consists only of allowed characters - Does not begin or end with a hyphen See from http://stackoverflow.com/a/2532344/ """ if len(value) == 0: raise ValueError("Cannot have 0 len hostname") if len(value) > 255: raise ValueError("%s hostname is greater than 255 chars" % value) if value[-1] == ".": value = value[:-1] allowed = re.compile("(?!-)[A-Z\d-]{1,63}(?<!-)$", re.IGNORECASE) if any((not allowed.match(x)) for x in value.split(".")): raise ValueError("%s is an invalid hostname" % value) return value def __repr__(self): return 'Hostname' def __eq__(self, other): return self.__class__ == other.__class__

commit_message:
Start container before systemd unit for nailgun and keystone

Dockerctl improperly detects readyness of docker container. Thus,
we need to start the container before corresponding systemd unit
(service).

Run container first ensures that the systemd unit properly finishes
its work.

Add wait function to check if container is ready as a fix for race
condition in dockerctl's check_ready function (bug #1545825).

Change-Id: Id34986f42dd9944969475d5e0c1bec9814746b5f
Closes-bug: 1545825

commit_message:
Add node attributes to release

* Add node_attributes field to Release model
* Add fixture to openstack.yaml
* Copy node attributes from release to node
  when node is assigned to cluster

Change-Id: Ib675c784f19f28dd94657e32228b9b79efb03240
Implements: blueprint support-numa-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Fix kombu accept different TTL since version 3.0.25

kombu accept TTL as seconds instead of millisecond since version 3.0.25,
We remove TTL conversion in commit d49ddc3b9828f097d5bb39bca0381386a9de7762,
which is valid only when kombu >=3.0.25, so need do conversion according
to kombu version.

Note: Remove this workaround when all supported branches with
requirement kombu >=3.0.25

Closes-Bug: #1531148
Change-Id: I762265f23084a95f2d24cb434bad7d9556d4edd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/90/281690/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import versionutils def _get_expiration(self, timeout): # NOTE(gcb) kombu accept TTL as seconds instead of millisecond since # version 3.0.25, so do conversion according to kombu version. # TODO(gcb) remove this workaround when all supported branches # with requirement kombu >=3.0.25 if timeout is not None: kombu_version = pkg_resources.get_distribution('kombu').version if not versionutils.is_compatible('3.0.25', kombu_version): timeout = int(timeout * 1000) return timeout producer.publish(msg, expiration=self._get_expiration(timeout),

subject: Fix image-create in CLI if token expires
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-15 17:37:55.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell_v2.py', 'glanceclient/v2/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/e236bb6008f45484fbb5faceb0a9173633fb1a00', 'message': "Fix image-create in CLI if token expires

Current implementation of image-create in CLI
supports optional --file parameter and if it's
provided then the creation workflow is the next:
1. Create an empty instance in queued status.
2. Upload an image file.
3. Get created image info.

Unfortunately if token expires during image upload
the 3rd step fails with 401 error and user sees
an error message even if image was successfully
created.

This commit fixes this by hadling 401 error with
recreating a client and sending the 'get' request
again.

Change-Id: I09cb2f222cac175f25cb5f0a3ddc9b156194d36e
Closes-bug: #1519546
"}]
commit_message:
Fix image-create in CLI if token expires

Current implementation of image-create in CLI
supports optional --file parameter and if it's
provided then the creation workflow is the next:
1. Create an empty instance in queued status.
2. Upload an image file.
3. Get created image info.

Unfortunately if token expires during image upload
the 3rd step fails with 401 error and user sees
an error message even if image was successfully
created.

This commit fixes this by hadling 401 error with
recreating a client and sending the 'get' request
again.

Change-Id: I09cb2f222cac175f25cb5f0a3ddc9b156194d36e
Closes-bug: #1519546
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/24/258024/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glanceclient import shell try: image = gc.images.get(args.id) except exc.HTTPUnauthorized: # if token expires during long image upload then we # recreate a client and try to get image metainfo again. osis = shell.OpenStackImagesShell() gc = osis._get_versioned_client(gc.version, args) image = gc.images.get(args.id)

commit_message:
packages: secure upgrade workflow from dependency cycles

Change the workflow to be:
Upgrade all packages before any services that is notified & managed by
Puppet.
It also disable the Exec timeout so we rely on Heat timeout and not on
the 300s that are the default in Puppet [1]

Example: we upgrade and OpenStack config will change (obviously).
         Puppet catalog will contain 3 important things:
           * config resources
           * service resources
           * package-upgrade Exec resource
         with that patch, what will happen:
           * puppet will update config first or second and notify
             services
           * puppet will run package-upgrade first or second but before
             the package-upgrade Exec resource
           * at the very end, puppet will restart services

That way, we avoid complications with Puppet dependency cycle issues.

[1] https://docs.puppetlabs.com/references/latest/type.html#exec-attribute-timeout

Closes-Bug: 1536349
Change-Id: I07310bdfc5b07b03ac9fa5f8c13e87eaa2bfef4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/88/268388/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # 1) Upgrade all packages via exec. # Note: The Package Puppet resources can be managed after or before package-upgrade, # it does not matter. what we need to make sure is that they'll notify their # respective services (if they have ~> in their manifests or here with the ->) # for the other packages, they'll be upgraded before any Service notify. # This approach prevents from Puppet dependencies cycle. # 2) This upgrade will be run before any Service notified & managed by Puppet. # Note: For example, during the Puppet catalog, configuration will change for most of # the services so the Services will be likely restarted after the package upgrade. Exec['package-upgrade'] -> Service <| |>
deleted_lines: # 1) upgrade puppet managed packages (will trigger puppet dependencies) # 2) then upgrade all packages via exec # 3) then restart services Package <| |> -> Exec['package-upgrade'] -> Service <| |>

commit_message:
Return error codes other than 1.

If exception has 'errno' attribute, it is returned instead of '1'.

Change-Id: I77ef6e91cb5a1ee99dfd3f078e8f7e961ffcf555
Related-bug: 1496842

commit_message:
Cluster capacity calculation fix

  - "HDD" capacity is counting from nodes with "stogare" roles
  - "CPU" & "RAM" are counting from nodes with "compute" roles

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1375750

Change-Id: I0a44cbfa60625ad06c879cf1aac01317b073b802

commit_message:
Move to nova.conf importing pattern

Pursuant to the centralize-config-options blueprint, this change set is
a step toward reaching all nova config options via nova.conf.

Change-Id: I383d1f14406596e2ed575beff19ef9cf3ca913da

subject: DNM: try to wrap mock.patch and mock.patch.object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-05 14:37:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/test.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e6aa457b18353ebbd120bcbe19e7c9291c69d3bb', 'message': 'DNM: try to wrap mock.patch and mock.patch.object

so that we can catch get_notifier mocks to forbid new legacy event_type

Change-Id: If1558d8a291a063f0274a58c8e87c5b708d60900
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: try to wrap mock.patch and mock.patch.object

so that we can catch get_notifier mocks to forbid new legacy event_type

Change-Id: If1558d8a291a063f0274a58c8e87c5b708d60900
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/276759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print 'notify', event_type self.mock_patch = mock.patch self.mock_patch_object = mock.patch.object def wrap_mock_patch(target, *args, **kwargs): if target.endswith('get_notifier'): print '!!' return self.mock_patch(target, *args, **kwargs) def wrap_mock_patch_object(target, attribute, *args, **kwargs): if attribute.endswith('get_notifier'): print '!!!' with self.mock_patch_object( target, attribute, *args, **kwargs) as mock_get_notifier: print 'original mock_get_notifier.return_value', mock_get_notifier.return_value mock_get_notifier.return_value = NotifierWrapper( mock_get_notifier.return_value, ALLOWED_LEGACY_NOTIFICATION_EVENT_TYPES) print 'mock_get_notifier.return_value', mock_get_notifier.return_value return self.mock_patch_object(target, attribute, *args, **kwargs) mock.patch = wrap_mock_patch mock.patch.object = wrap_mock_patch_object mock.patch = self.mock_patch mock._patch_object = self.mock_patch_object

commit_message:
Show All Node network groups button

Now it's possible to see the list of all networks
at one tab

- added 'group/all' to subtab routes
- added 'data-name' attribute to node network group
  title for testing needs

Closes-bug: #1518283
Change-Id: Ia0488a30196d0e63a7cc1d535ae9785ce2a1b4ba

subject: Refactor openstack-controller task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-08 21:23:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/f64bcb6e85b2a1aa49885edc0f358d9343a0d2e9', 'message': 'Refacter openstack-controller task

This change refactors the openstack-controller task to remove the
openstack::controller module and pull the nova configuration straight
into the task. As part of this refactoring we are also addressing the
idempotent issues around the use of tweaks::ubuntu_service_override for
packages and services we are not including. As part of the refactoring
we are also addresssing the fact that the default_floating_pool was not
being properly configured durring this task which could result in nova
misconfiguration if this task was executed after a deployment.

Change-Id: I2acd443f60f9bebdc828d59aecd11cf453fc8c67
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-08 23:04:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/48ce0da605f4acb05ca1474bbd44feeaf7c3a24f', 'message': 'Refactor openstack-controller task

This change refactors the openstack-controller task to remove the
openstack::controller module, pull the nova configuration straight
into the task, and remove nova-network items.

As part of this refactoring we are also addressing the idempotent
issues around the use of tweaks::ubuntu_service_override for
packages and services we are not including.

Additionally we are also addresssing the fact that the
default_floating_pool was not being properly configured durring this
task which could result in nova misconfiguration if this task was
executed after a deployment.

Additionally we are also addresssing the fact that the
default_floating_pool was not being properly configured durring this
task which could result in nova misconfiguration if this task was
executed after a deployment.

Change-Id: I2acd443f60f9bebdc828d59aecd11cf453fc8c67
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor openstack-controller task

This change refactors the openstack-controller task to remove the
openstack::controller module, pull the nova configuration straight
into the task, and remove nova-network items.

As part of this refactoring we are also addressing the idempotent
issues around the use of tweaks::ubuntu_service_override for
packages and services we are not including.

Additionally we are also addresssing the fact that the
default_floating_pool was not being properly configured durring this
task which could result in nova misconfiguration if this task was
executed after a deployment.

Change-Id: I2acd443f60f9bebdc828d59aecd11cf453fc8c67
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency

commit_message:
Avoid KeyError on instance_id in ensure_service_instance

There are cases where the server details don't have an instance_id
set but we need to check for that so we can avoid a KeyError. We
also log this case as a warning like the InstanceNotFound in the same
method. Ideally we'd log the share server ID for context but we don't
have that available in this method which is given ShareServerBackendDetails
key/values.

Change-Id: I8cabf7f3a5a3480a1f55a19fbdcebfc272906332
Closes-Bug: #1542365

subject: Repeat node installation after upgrade failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-20 01:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['octane/commands/install_node.py', 'octane/handlers/install/cinder.py', 'octane/tests/test_install_node.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane/commit/3629102677ac0da35b84e2c76027609f9fe8d55c', 'message': 'Repeat node installation after upgrade failure

If the node already belongs to Upgrade Seed environment, assume it was
moved there during upgrade procedure. Thus, no need to update node
attributes.

Use separate function to install such node, effectively repeating upgrade
procedure from the very beginning, replacing move of node with ordinary
provisioning.

Closes-bug: 1506405
Change-Id: I7052c0528027c15aee2342dea3b66fbef5f3e56e
'}]
commit_message:
Repeat node installation after upgrade failure

If the node already belongs to Upgrade Seed environment, assume it was
moved there during upgrade procedure. Thus, no need to update node
attributes.

Use separate function to install such node, effectively repeating upgrade
procedure from the very beginning, replacing move of node with ordinary
provisioning.

Closes-bug: 1506405
Change-Id: I7052c0528027c15aee2342dea3b66fbef5f3e56e

commit_message:
Fix the field's order of db tables

The field's order of all db tables should keep the same.
Adjust the created_at, updated_at, deleted_at and deleted ahead.

There are not service_id and status fields
in the scheduled_operations table.

Change-Id: I5a0e050722868a67c1cdf8796c712e0171b9453a
Closes-Bug: #1540793

commit_message:
Pluggable protection provider doc

Change-Id: I64dce168322cf607951bada5ac0eb19f80c4b09e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/64/262264/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Pluggable Protection Provider ============================= The *Pluggable Protection Provider* will be the reference implementation protection provider. It's purpose is to be fully pluggable and extandable so that only extream use cases will need to implement their own Protection Provider from scratch. The protection provider will contain internally a map between any registered *Protectable* and a corrosponding *Protection Plugin*. When the pluggable protection provider is asked to perform an action, it will walk over the graph and pass a context object to the appropriate plugin whenever a node is encountered. The resource graph is traversed in with DFS. When a node is first encountered the protection manager gets the plugin for the appropriate resource type, builds a context and passes it to the plugins `get_pre_task()` method. The plugin can return any tasks that it wants added to the task list. When all of a node childrens have been visited the `get_pre_task()` is called. The task returned from this method will also be added to the task list but is also guranteed to execute after all the child node's tasks have finished. Any of the methods can return `None` if they don't want any action performed. After the entire grap has been traversed the Protection Provider will return the task lists which will be queued and than executed according to the executor's policy. When all the tasks are done the operation is considered complete. This scheme decouples the tree structure form the task execution. A plugin that handles multiple resources or that aggregates mutiple resources to one task can use this mechanism to only return tasks when appropriate for it's scheme.

commit_message:
Upgrade all packages after puppet managed ones

This updates tripleo::packages so that when enable_upgrade
is used it will:

 1) upgrade puppet managed packages (will trigger puppet dependencies)
 2) then upgrade all packages via exec
 3) then restart services

NOTE: the intention here is that the Exec['update-packages'] will
always execute if enable_upgrade is set. It is not idempotent
in this regard because I think we always want to execute it
if enable_upgrade is set.

Change-Id: I02f7cf07792765359f19fdf357024d9e48690e42
Related-bug: #1522943
(cherry picked from commit 62e74d9663bdedf50cb77db5cfc843fc940149bc)

Implemented node roles keyboard navigation

    and select/unselect role by pressing Enter key

subject: Always do cleanup after a failed stack update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 00:20:13.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/2c24badd55cdf90ba79bedc6ea18516ba0b5e6ca', 'message': "Always do cleanup after a failed stack update

Move the cleanup code (that sets the status to FAILED and merges the new
environment into the old one) so that it runs on any exception, including
exit exceptions (due to e.g. the thread being cancelled or the engine
restarted). In the case of the environment this isn't as good as merging
them before the update starts (since it's possible for Heat to die without
time to run exception handlers), but at least it leaves things consistent
in the orderly case.

Change-Id: Ia4d2deca393ac9e250932c5cdb3691b6ee2b3ef4
Partial-bug: #1544348
Related-bug: #1492433
"}]
commit_message:
Always do cleanup after a failed stack update

Move the cleanup code (that sets the status to FAILED and merges the new
environment into the old one) so that it runs on any exception, including
exit exceptions (due to e.g. the thread being cancelled or the engine
restarted). In the case of the environment this isn't as good as merging
them before the update starts (since it's possible for Heat to die without
time to run exception handlers), but at least it leaves things consistent
in the orderly case.

Change-Id: Ia4d2deca393ac9e250932c5cdb3691b6ee2b3ef4
Partial-bug: #1544348
Related-bug: #1492433
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/06/278806/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: should_rollback = False except (ForcedCancel, Exception) as e: should_rollback = self._update_exception_handler(e, action, update_task) if should_rollback: except BaseException as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): self._update_exception_handler(e, action, update_task) finally: if should_rollback: # Already handled in rollback task return # Don't use state_set to do only one update query and avoid race # condition with the COMPLETE status self.action = action self._send_notification_and_add_event() if self.status == self.FAILED: # Since template was incrementally updated based on existing # and new stack resources, we should have user params of both. existing_params.load(newstack.t.env.user_env_as_dict()) self.t.env = existing_params self.t.store(self.context) backup_stack.t.env = existing_params backup_stack.t.store(self.context) self.store() if previous_template_id is not None: raw_template_object.RawTemplate.delete(self.context, previous_template_id) lifecycle_plugin_utils.do_post_ops(self.context, self, newstack, action, (self.status == self.FAILED)) elif isinstance(exc, exception.ResourceFailure): return not self.disable_rollback else: return False
deleted_lines: except (ForcedCancel, exception.ResourceFailure) as e: if self._update_exception_handler( exc=e, action=action, update_task=update_task): return # Don't use state_set to do only one update query and avoid race # condition with the COMPLETE status self.action = action self._send_notification_and_add_event() if self.status == self.FAILED: # Since template was incrementally updated based on existing and # new stack resources, we should have user params of both. existing_params.load(newstack.t.env.user_env_as_dict()) self.t.env = existing_params self.t.store(self.context) backup_stack.t.env = existing_params backup_stack.t.store(self.context) self.store() if previous_template_id is not None: raw_template_object.RawTemplate.delete(self.context, previous_template_id) lifecycle_plugin_utils.do_post_ops(self.context, self, newstack, action, (self.status == self.FAILED)) return not self.disable_rollback

commit_message:
Add tags for neutron resources spec

Introduce a generic mechanism to allow the user to set tags
on Neutron resources.

Change-Id: I86e0c4f3081a83fa881ee8db860a3548deaeaeea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/21/216021/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Add Metadata Information to Neutron Resources ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/add-metadata-to-core-resources Neutron resources in current DB model does not contain any labels or metadata, and dont have a generic consistent way to add external id's by the user. Adding metadata/external id's to resources can be useful for management and orchestration in OpenStack. The following use cases refer to adding metadata to networks, but the same can be applicable to any other Neutron resource (core resource and Router): 1) Ability to map different networks in different OpenStack locations to one logically same network (for Multi site OpenStack) 2) Ability to map Id's from different management/orchestration systems to OpenStack networks in mixed environments, for example for project Kuryr, map docker network id to neutron network id 3) Provide easy mapping for orchestration/deployment systems that want to use something other then just a name or id 4) Leverage metadata by deployment tools Problem Description =================== Neutron resources doesnt support adding metadata information supplied by the user/admin and attach it to a specific resource id. Proposed Change =============== In a similar way to port binding extension (and more specifically the port binding profile) a new extension for resource metadata will be added to allow a user to create/update a specific resource metadata values in a dictionary structure. Data Model Impact ----------------- New DB extension is provided to extend core resources and router db model and allow a mapping between resource id and a metadata dictionary which can be updated/created by user. This new extension is implemented in a different table for efficiency and to provide a relative non-intrusive approach to current code REST API Impact --------------- +----------+-----------------+---------+---------+------------+---------------+ |Attribute |Type |Access |Default |Validation/ |Description | |Name | | |Value |Conversion | | +==========+=================+=========+=========+============+===============+ |resource |string |RO, all |generated|N/A |identity | |id |(UUID) | | | | | +----------+-----------------+---------+---------+------------+---------------+ |metadata |dictionary |RW | None | N/A | external | | |<string,string> | | | | metadata id's | | | | | | | for resource | +----------+-----------------+---------+---------+------------+---------------+ Security Impact --------------- Resource metadata must only be created/updated by tenant or admin. Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ DB is extended for every metadata actually stored for a specific core resource (only if metadata is supplied). Resource retrieval/updates needs to also fetch metadata information if exists. IPv6 Impact ----------- None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Deployer will be able to attach external id's or any metadata to resources and filter according to it Developer Impact ---------------- Developer will be able to attach external id's or any metadata to resources and filter according to it Community Impact ---------------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: gal-sagie <gal.sagie@gmail.com> Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Create DB extension * Add attachment for each core resource and router * DB migrations * Add testing * Add documentation Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Tempest Tests ------------- None Functional Tests ---------------- Add testing for setting/retrieving information internally from the DB layer API Tests --------- Add API tests to validate set/retrieval of metadata information per resource Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ Add new API change to user documentation Developer Documentation ----------------------- Add new API change to devref documentation References ========== None

commit_message:
Add Redis DB Driver and Redis PubSub Driver

Change-Id: I29820546f336de47e103e24ad49e9f0c29d8ae6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/01/281801/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import redis from dragonflow.db.drivers.redis_mgt import RedisMgt from oslo_log import log from dragonflow.common import exceptions as df_exceptions from dragonflow.db import db_api LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class RedisDbDriver(db_api.DbApi): def __init__(self): super(RedisDbDriver, self).__init__() self.client = [] self.remote = [] #self.redis_mgt = RedisMgt() # need realize connection to DBcluster,record DB Cluster Slot redis_mgt = RedisMgt() def initialize(self, db_ip, db_port, **args): # get remote ip port list self.redis_mgt._load_so() self.redis_mgt.init_default_node(db_ip, db_port) self.redis_mgt.get_cluster_topology() self.remote = self.redis_mgt.get_master_list() for i in range(len(self.remote)): ip_port = self.remote[i].split(':') self.client[i] = redis.client.StrictRedis(host=ip_port[0],port=ip_port[1]) @staticmethod def get_redis_mgt(): return redis_mgt def support_publish_subscribe(self): return True # return nil is not found def get_key(self, table, key,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].get(local_key) except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def set_key(self, table, key, value,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) res = self.client[i].set(local_key,value) if not res == 'OK': self.client[i].delete('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) return res except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def create_key(self, table, key, value,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) res = self.client[i].set(local_key, value) if not res == 'OK': self.client[i].delete(local_key) return res except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeySetFailed(key=local_key) # return 0 means not found def delete_key(self, table, key,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].delete('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) # return nil is not found def get_all_entries(self,table,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+'*') try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].get('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+'*') except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def get_all_keys(self, table): pass def _allocate_unique_key(self): pass def allocate_unique_key(self): pass # no need to realize def register_notification_callback(self, callback): pass def uuid_to_key (self,tenant_id, table,uuid): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + tenant_id + '}' + '.'+uuid) return local_key def check_connection(self,ip,port): try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(ip+';'+port) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) self.client[i].get(None) except (redis.exceptions.ConnectionError, redis.exceptions.BusyLoadingError): return False return True def register_topic_for_notification(self, topic): # TODO(gsagie) implement this pass def unregister_topic_for_notification(self, topic): # TODO(gsagie) implement this pass

commit_message:
Don't use hidden image property in sahara cluster

Image property of sahara cluster is hidden now. So it
is resolved by translation rules. No need to use it.

Change-Id: I714cf2a2db0c203d1ee44b85606f333467a18ef8

commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_load() instead of yaml.load()

yaml.load() provides the ability to construct an arbitrary python object
that may be dangerous. yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple
python objects like integers or lists.

ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YAML#Security

Change-Id: I9c28c25f4265fb691d39e72e20ef9c99f5538bf5

commit_message:
Don't check existence of keystone resource for empty value

We apply keystone constraints(such as keystone.project) for
some properties, if user specify the empty string for these
properties, don't to get the resource from keystone backend
when constraint validating, due an error
heatclient.exc.HTTPBadRequest will be raised, raise notFound
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1517731

Change-Id: Ia3be51468fbef5660965dbcc93d28af49245e51c

commit_message:
[docs]Update the package-import version parameter

Murano client rename the package-import parameter 'version'
to 'package-version', So update the cli docs.

commit_message:
Add test for performance in constraint validation

There are follow important changes in patch:
 - New constraint was added. This constraint emulate delay during
   resolving custom constraint for property.
 - New property was added for TestResource. This property uses new
   constraint.
 - Added Rally scenario create-delete, which uses template with
   ResourceGroup of TestResources with custom constraint.


Depends-On: I06183138d54c1cb971a58a158a15f3f5b25cba4d

Change-Id: I53d83f59be9bd27db451f87aaae2d8446f287c17

commit_message:
Add Redis DB Driver and Redis PubSib

Change-Id: Ie36fd44f331559c91683945d7a61be1cc2f942f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/95/281795/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import redis from dragonflow.db.drivers.redis_mgt import RedisMgt from oslo_log import log from dragonflow.common import exceptions as df_exceptions from dragonflow.db import db_api LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class RedisDbDriver(db_api.DbApi): def __init__(self): super(RedisDbDriver, self).__init__() self.client = [] self.remote = [] #self.redis_mgt = RedisMgt() # need realize connection to DBcluster,record DB Cluster Slot redis_mgt = RedisMgt() def initialize(self, db_ip, db_port, **args): # get remote ip port list self.redis_mgt._load_so() self.redis_mgt.init_default_node(db_ip, db_port) self.redis_mgt.get_cluster_topology() self.remote = self.redis_mgt.get_master_list() for i in range(len(self.remote)): ip_port = self.remote[i].split(':') self.client[i] = redis.client.StrictRedis(host=ip_port[0],port=ip_port[1]) @staticmethod def get_redis_mgt(): return redis_mgt def support_publish_subscribe(self): return True # return nil is not found def get_key(self, table, key,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].get(local_key) except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def set_key(self, table, key, value,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) res = self.client[i].set(local_key,value) if not res == 'OK': self.client[i].delete('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) return res except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def create_key(self, table, key, value,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) res = self.client[i].set(local_key, value) if not res == 'OK': self.client[i].delete(local_key) return res except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeySetFailed(key=local_key) # return 0 means not found def delete_key(self, table, key,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].delete('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) # return nil is not found def get_all_entries(self,table,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+'*') try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].get('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+'*') except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def get_all_keys(self, table): pass def _allocate_unique_key(self): pass def allocate_unique_key(self): pass # no need to realize def register_notification_callback(self, callback): pass def uuid_to_key (self,tenant_id, table,uuid): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + tenant_id + '}' + '.'+uuid) return local_key def check_connection(self,ip,port): try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(ip+';'+port) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) self.client[i].get(None) except (redis.exceptions.ConnectionError, redis.exceptions.BusyLoadingError): return False return True def register_topic_for_notification(self, topic): # TODO(gsagie) implement this pass def unregister_topic_for_notification(self, topic): # TODO(gsagie) implement this pass

commit_message:
Add test to check required image-create options

This test checks that disk-format and container-format options are
required during image-create

Change-Id: Idb71ae491cd313e0658d7a4cd72fa7d12d4e400e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/86/281686/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import subprocess import uuid from glanceclient.tests.functional import base class NegativeGlanceClientTest(base.ClientTestBase): def setUp(self): super(NegativeGlanceClientTest, self).setUp() self.image_name = "image_{}".format(str(uuid.uuid4())[:4]) subprocess.check_call('fallocate -l 100MB {}'.format(self.image_name), shell=True) def tearDown(self): os.remove(self.image_name) super(NegativeGlanceClientTest, self).tearDown() def test_upload_image_wo_disk_format_and_container_format(self): """Checks that disk-format and container-format are required""" cmd = 'image-create --name Test --file {0} --progress'.format( self.image_name) out = self.glance(cmd, fail_ok=True, merge_stderr=True) self.assertIn('error: Must provide --container-format, --disk-format ' 'when using --file', out) out = self.glance('image-list') images = self.parser.listing(out) self.assertNotIn('Test', [x['Name'] for x in images])

commit_message:
Add pypi jobs to refstack.

As mentioned in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279511/
we suggested to deploy Refstack from latest release
on pypi instead of changing tags every release.

Review for puppet-refstack module is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281737/

Change-Id: I1d6764ace35d92acd6dbf7bfe1175a23a2261f2a

commit_message:
Check return value of App.run() in tests

Sometimes (mostly when debug is off) Cliff can return failure by
returning nonzero exit code from App.run() instead of raising
SystemExit. Catch such errors in octane_app fixture (SafeOctaneApp
class).

Change-Id: If2f87aa9dc0dbd25ddb1ff8909ea9fb1552bf408
(cherry picked from commit 40fd9e50c2cf5bdff9bb921b355ec56e09f25de5)

commit_message:
Turn on debug by default in SafeOctaneApp fixture

This would prevent Cliff from hiding parsing errors and such by just
returning appropriate exit code and make it pass all exceptions through.

Change-Id: Ia81df8ec035fdb6ffa3876d7bf8d6f873b1f0ac8
(cherry picked from commit 89c8b626e0f43c821539b93aeb0a6d443e28d3cb)

commit_message:
Turn on debug by default in SafeOctaneApp fixture

This would prevent Cliff from hiding parsing errors and such by just
returning appropriate exit code and make it pass all exceptions through.

Change-Id: Ia81df8ec035fdb6ffa3876d7bf8d6f873b1f0ac8
(cherry picked from commit 89c8b626e0f43c821539b93aeb0a6d443e28d3cb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/31/281731/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def build_option_parser(self, description, version, argparse_kwargs=None): parser = super(SafeOctaneApp, self).build_option_parser( description, version, argparse_kwargs) parser.set_defaults(debug=True) return parser

Add Redis DB Driver and Redis PubSub Driver

Change-Id: I475f79ea7deeb85ca72daf99d177fadb5f7fd7bc

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import redis from dragonflow.db.drivers.redis_mgt import RedisMgt from oslo_log import log from dragonflow.common import exceptions as df_exceptions from dragonflow.db import db_api LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class RedisDbDriver(db_api.DbApi): def __init__(self): super(RedisDbDriver, self).__init__() self.client = [] self.remote = [] #self.redis_mgt = RedisMgt() # need realize connection to DBcluster,record DB Cluster Slot redis_mgt = RedisMgt() def initialize(self, db_ip, db_port, **args): # get remote ip port list self.redis_mgt._load_so() self.redis_mgt.init_default_node(db_ip, db_port) self.redis_mgt.get_cluster_topology() self.remote = self.redis_mgt.get_master_list() for i in range(len(self.remote)): ip_port = self.remote[i].split(':') self.client[i] = redis.client.StrictRedis(host=ip_port[0],port=ip_port[1]) @staticmethod def get_redis_mgt(): return redis_mgt def support_publish_subscribe(self): return True # return nil is not found def get_key(self, table, key,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].get(local_key) except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def set_key(self, table, key, value,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) res = self.client[i].set(local_key,value) if not res == 'OK': self.client[i].delete('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) return res except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def create_key(self, table, key, value,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) res = self.client[i].set(local_key, value) if not res == 'OK': self.client[i].delete(local_key) return res except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeySetFailed(key=local_key) # return 0 means not found def delete_key(self, table, key,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].delete('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+key) except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) # return nil is not found def get_all_entries(self,table,topic=None): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+'*') try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(local_key) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) return self.client[i].get('{'+table + '.' + topic + '}' + '.'+'*') except Exception, exception: raise df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound(key=local_key) def get_all_keys(self, table): pass def _allocate_unique_key(self): pass def allocate_unique_key(self): pass # no need to realize def register_notification_callback(self, callback): pass def uuid_to_key (self,tenant_id, table,uuid): local_key = ('{'+table + '.' + tenant_id + '}' + '.'+uuid) return local_key def check_connection(self,ip,port): try: ip_port = self.redis_mgt.assign_to_node(ip+';'+port) i = self.remote.index(ip_port) self.client[i].get(None) except (redis.exceptions.ConnectionError, redis.exceptions.BusyLoadingError): return False return True def register_topic_for_notification(self, topic): # TODO(gsagie) implement this pass def unregister_topic_for_notification(self, topic): # TODO(gsagie) implement this pass

subject: auto install security rules for egress port of sfc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-28 12:22:40.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/common/exceptions.py', 'networking_sfc/extensions/sfc.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc/commit/a49d619a52a1fa09cb457843f96b2e3aa68d7292', 'message': "auto install security rules for egress port of sfc

by default, the port security of Neutron port is enabled. the fixed
security rule <ip/mac> pair will be installed for egress traffic.
only the fixed ips and allowed address pair can be permitted. The
traffic on the service chain will travel multiple sfc group ports.
if these sfc group ports enable the port security, the source ip
of traffic should be configured on these groups ports'
allowed_address_pairs, then the traffic can be outbound from these
ports.

at present, There are two selections to install the security rules
for sfc group ports, one is the upper layer MANO(Management and
Orchestration) to configure for sfc groups. the other is sfc plugin
or driver to auto install security rules according the extension
configuration. the patch implements the second one.

1. portchain interface extension
define auto_install_security_rules for the extension parameters
chain-parameters, when auto_install_security_rules=True, it indicate
driver will auto install security rules for egress port of sfc

2. how to enable this feature
eg,
neutron port-chain-create
		--chain-parameters auto_install_security_rules=True
		--port-pair-group e65a5dd6-5a8c-49e0-91d4-90351cf8cdde
		--flow-classifier 8a583d69-7eb6-4cf4-b10f-8060caee0b20
		client1_sf1_server1

Change-Id: I72b5e342e5896d48f1e2fa3d1053431bd7fb8109
"}]
commit_message:
auto install security rules for egress port of sfc

by default, the port security of Neutron port is enabled. the fixed
security rule <ip/mac> pair will be installed for egress traffic.
only the fixed ips and allowed address pair can be permitted. The
traffic on the service chain will travel multiple sfc group ports.
if these sfc group ports enable the port security, the source ip
of traffic should be configured on these groups ports'
allowed_address_pairs, then the traffic can be outbound from these
ports.

at present, There are two selections to install the security rules
for sfc group ports, one is the upper layer MANO(Management and
Orchestration) to configure for sfc groups. the other is sfc plugin
or driver to auto install security rules according the extension
configuration. the patch implements the second one.

1. portchain interface extension
define auto_install_security_rules for the extension parameters
chain-parameters, when auto_install_security_rules=True, it indicate
driver will auto install security rules for egress port of sfc

2. how to enable this feature
eg,
neutron port-chain-create
		--chain-parameters auto_install_security_rules=True
		--port-pair-group e65a5dd6-5a8c-49e0-91d4-90351cf8cdde
		--flow-classifier 8a583d69-7eb6-4cf4-b10f-8060caee0b20
		client1_sf1_server1

Change-Id: I72b5e342e5896d48f1e2fa3d1053431bd7fb8109

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I4aa8c4aee1fd2bcccf9fc1dca2ece6022df70a70

subject: Extract ver/acc/con/obj instead of self._get_vaco
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 06:16:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/3626ac59b676ac4b06171ebfdc25a68018a04c05', 'message': 'Extract ver/acc/con/obj instead of self._get_vaco

While refactoring in previous work, we find a lot of gateway
method (and logging message) need a part of request path like
account, container, object. In the work, we employed self._get_vaco
method which parses the path and returns a tuple
(version, account, container, object) to get the part of path with holding
the older behavior for clarifying what was refactored.

And now, we can focus on to replace whole self._get_vaco into self.vars.

Basically 2 changes are in this patch:

1. Merge every self._get_vaco into BaseStorletHandler:
self._get_vaco will be called when the handler is init and extract into
each variables to be able to be referenced directly.

2. Tied up request information to Handler
The variables like self.account will be duplicated information with
actual request instance and they can be maintained as different
variables. (i.e. if set account name directly like "self.account='acc'",
it might be different the account in self.request.path)

To prevent such an unexpected inconsistency, this patch add the wrap of
"self.request" variables to extract the ver/acc/cont/obj value each time
when the request variable assigned. And also this disallowed the direct
assinment for ver/acc/cont/obj in the Handler itself.

*bonus*
- Fix to raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented (which is
  just a Type!)

Change-Id: Iccf0487d6aafd462f1290595d645966d0059474e

commit_message:
Extract ver/acc/con/obj instead of self._get_vaco

While refactoring in previous work, we find a lot of gateway
method (and logging message) need a part of request path like
account, container, object. In the work, we employed self._get_vaco
method which parses the path and returns a tuple
(version, account, container, object) to get the part of path with holding
the older behavior for clarifying what was refactored.

And now, we can focus on to replace whole self._get_vaco into self.vars.

Basically 2 changes are in this patch:

1. Merge every self._get_vaco into BaseStorletHandler:
self._get_vaco will be called when the handler is init and extract into
each variables to be able to be referenced directly.

2. Tied up request information to Handler
The variables like self.account will be duplicated information with
actual request instance and they can be maintained as different
variables. (i.e. if set account name directly like "self.account='acc'",
it might be different the account in self.request.path)

To prevent such an unexpected inconsistency, this patch add the wrap of
"self.request" variables to extract the ver/acc/cont/obj value each time
when the request variable assigned. And also this disallowed the direct
assinment for ver/acc/cont/obj in the Handler itself.

*bonus*
- Fix to raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented (which is
  just a Type!)

Change-Id: Iccf0487d6aafd462f1290595d645966d0059474e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/77/280077/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _request_instance_property(): """ Set and retrieve the request instance. This works to force to tie the consistency between the request path and self.vars (i.e. api_version, account, container, obj) even if unexpectedly (separately) assigned. """ def getter(self): return self._request def setter(self, request): self._request = request try: self._extract_vaco() except ValueError: raise NotStorletRequest() return property(getter, setter, doc="Force to tie the request to acc/con/obj vars") request = _request_instance_property() self.conf, self.logger, self.app, self.api_version, self.account, self.container, self.obj) def _extract_vaco(self): """ Set version, account, container, obj vars from self._parse_vaco result :raises ValueError: if self._parse_vaco raises ValueError while parsing, this method doesn't care and raise it to upper caller. commit_message:
shrink test length

this minimises the amount of data we write to test that we just
update specific subset.

this patch also removes the ability to configure chunk size as it's
never used and will explode if we allow it to be configurable

Change-Id: Ib7f2f79ceab82dea04278e14da86c147697ff05a

Add api_paste type/provider for Sahara

Add the capability to configure api-paste.ini with config.pp.
Closes-bug: #1483371

commit_message:
minimise calls when generating report

in swift and ceph backends, we make a separate call for every single
metric to gather the measures for each metric specifically. we
don't really need this and some of the output doesn't even make it
visible. this also might be thousands of calls depending on backlog
size.

this patch adds a high-level summary equivalent to what we currently
show and a details param to display full per metric details.

Change-Id: I3e8d887e22d4941673a658f60c3b3c4816c51133
Closes-Bug: #1544081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/27/279827/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-17 15:11:46.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/fuel_9_0.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/9101d89c630721aba56c5d00d3eb3c72d8a80c37', 'message': "Fix random failure on syncdb()

Nailgun tests fail time to time trying to execute syncdb(). This happens
because our tests keep dirty state after their execution, and some fake
releases may have 'roles_metadata = null' which brokes assumption of
our 9.0 migration.

It's better to mark this (and other) column as not-nullable in database,
however a lot of tests violate that constraint and require fixing.

Change-Id: I072ebf2564d8d1d9312d2bd41a383a18587636a4
Closes-Bug: #1546566
"}]
commit_message:
Fix random failure on syncdb()

Nailgun tests fail time to time trying to execute syncdb(). This happens
because our tests keep dirty state after their execution, and some fake
releases may have 'roles_metadata = null' which brokes assumption of
our 9.0 migration.

It's better to mark this (and other) column as not-nullable in database,
however a lot of tests violate that constraint and require fixing.

So the best option is to fix migration in order to unblock other patches
on CI.

Change-Id: I072ebf2564d8d1d9312d2bd41a383a18587636a4
Closes-Bug: #1546566

commit_message:
ceph: delete measures asynchronously

we should be able to delete measures asynchronously and free up
metricd to do other stuff.

for the unprocessed measures, we first (sync) remove xattr so it
won't be returned in subsequent queries so we don't really care when
object deletion finishes

for stored measures, we first set status to 'delete' in indexer so
it can't be queried so again, we really don't care when object deletion
finishes.

Change-Id: Ib2b5cc7e609c8910bff70f1c794cf007aaa28918

subject: Add restore_volume_id in backup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-23 07:20:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/ab3d11b3bbe6c36e52b851d69ac4a22059b62298', 'message': 'Add restore_volume_id in backup

This patch is to add restore_volume_id in backup object.
When restoring a volume from a backup, it saves the
volume in backup object.

Currently volume service and backup service are in same host.
When backup service starts, it does cleanup tasks on both
backs and volumes on current host.

But with the bp scaling backup service, backup service and
volume services can run on different hosts. When doing cleanup
tasks, we need to find out backing-up and restoring volumes
related to the backups on current host. Backing-up volumes can
be found with field backup.volume_id. Restoring volumes are found
by new field backup.restore_volume_id.

Change-Id: I757be7a5e47fc366c181400587b5a61fe3709a0b
Partial-Implements: bp scalable-backup-service
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-24 03:19:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/53a7d45640c764391f9c776a7d1629f245513a5e', 'message': 'Add restore_volume_id in backup

When backup service starts, it does cleanup tasks on both
backups and volumes on current host.

But with bp scalable-backup-service, backup service and
volume services can run on different hosts. When doing cleanup
tasks, we need to find out backing-up and restoring volumes
related to the backups on current host. Backing-up volumes can
be found with field backup.volume_id. Restoring volumes are found
by new field backup.restore_volume_id.

commit_message:
Add restore_volume_id in backup

This patch is to add restore_volume_id in backup object.
When restoring a volume from a backup, it saves the
volume in backup object.

Currently volume service and backup service are in same host.
When backup service starts, it does cleanup tasks on both
backups and volumes on current host.

But with bp scalable-backup-service, backup service and
volume services can run on different hosts. When doing cleanup
tasks, we need to find out backing-up and restoring volumes
related to the backups on current host. Backing-up volumes can
be found with field backup.volume_id. Restoring volumes are found
by new field backup.restore_volume_id.

Change-Id: I757be7a5e47fc366c181400587b5a61fe3709a0b
Partial-Implements: bp scalable-backup-service
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>

commit_message:
Refactoring all cli related tests

 * Use ssh_manager instead of context manager and remote
 * delete remote as variable of function, all methods are executed
   on master node so it is not necessary
 * changes was accepted for cli tests , test_cli_base, and
   create_backup_reset_restore_and_deploy_via_cli test

Change-Id: Ib98243af7919f231818f5896244c8f37c70c54fb
Closes-Bug: #1544229

subject: Ensure fdopen uses greenio object under eventlet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 02:10:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.privsep/commit/4c911ac572c5ab4f3bde49979e39f4982d9a17fb', 'message': "Use eventlet greenthreads if eventlet is installed

There are currently two places in oslo.privsep where we need to respond
to IO events asynchronously, and this is/was done using threads.  The
previous version naively used the standard `threading` module, which
means native threads or possibly eventlet greenthreads if `threading`
had been monkeypatched.

Nova (as one example) uses eventlet for socket IO, but does not patch
threading.  The threading code in oslo.privsep turns out to not work for
reasons I don't care to investigate right now (strace says a thread
simply isn't created).  This version more aggressively uses eventlet's
greenthreads if they're available - and only uses native threads if the
eventlet import fails.

commit_message:
Ensure fdopen uses greenio object under eventlet

The _fd_logger function works around a regular Unix pipe, with a python
file object wrapped around both pipe file descriptors.  This would be
stupidly simple and obvious, except eventlet.

We need to use the fdopen from io.open(), and not os.fdopen() (on py2;
on py3 they're the same), because the older python file objects have
broken behaviour regarding blocking reads.  Eventlet doesn't monkey
patch os.pipe, nor anything in io.* - so none of the existing eventlet
monkey_patching will "just work" for our case.

This change adds a custom `fdopen` function that explicitly uses
greenio.GreenPipe or io.open as appropriate - and uses this to always
return an eventlet-safe file object.

Change-Id: I4a6c0d4247aca17536316fb0ab163241ad545b20

Remove execute permissions from doc files and swift.conf-sample

Some doc files and swift.conf-sample were added execute permissions in past changes.
This patch remove execute permissions from them.

commit_message:
Properly handle statuses for nodes in FakeProvisionTask

The provision task and deployment tasks was splitted.
But fake deployment task handles deployment and provisioning state.
The patch moves provisioning state workflow into Fake deployment task.
Also replaced string letters with appropriate constants in fake tasks.

Change-Id: I1d2b4c3ae106e00bcfc2b7d904025421b18bc0da
Closes-Bug: 1515893

commit_message:
Added goal filter in Watcher API

Although it was proposed via python-watcherclient, the feature was
not implemented on the Watcher API.
As the notion of host aggregate is currently unused in Watcher,
decision was made to only implement the filtering of goal within
the Watcher API whilst removing the host_aggregate filter from the
Watcher client.
Thus, this patchset adds this missing functionality by adding the
'goal' parameter to the API.

Change-Id: I54d248f7e470249c6412650ddf50a3e3631d2a09
Related-Bug: #1510189

commit_message:
Improve variable names in strategy implementations

Renamed many of the variables and method parameters
in the strategy implementations to make the names
more meaningful.  Also changed the abstract method
signature in base.py to reflect these changes.

Closes-Bug: #1541615

Change-Id: Ibeba6c6ef6d5b70482930f387b05d5d650812355

commit_message:
Support conditions function

Support conditionally create resource or output with
conditions function.

Change-Id: Ie4f33ebccbda221441ea69bb6aa1b1cb6f968b05
Blueprint: support-conditions-function
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/42/245042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================== Support Conditions function =========================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/support-conditions-function This blueprint will provide the ability to create resource conditionally. Problem description =================== http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/conditions-section-structure.html AWS CloudFormation supports conditions function, it decides which resources are created or not based on the result of the condition. The conditions function is very useful of reusing templates, with conditions, user can create different sets of resources in different contexts(such as a test environment versus a production environment) with same template. Heat now does not have the ability, user need many templates to satisfy their requirements, it makes templates management become much more complex. Proposed change =============== Considering the user habits and compatibility with AWS CloudFormation, this propose will use the same style as CloudFormation for conditions function. An example of conditions function using a hot template:: heat_template_version: 2016-04-08 parameters: env_type: type: string default: 'test' allowed_values: ['prod', 'test'] conditions: { 'for_prod': {equals: [{get_param: env_type}, 'prod']} } resources: server: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: image: cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-disk flavor: m1.small floating_ip: type: OS::Nova::FloatingIP condition: 'for_prod' properties: pool: public floating_ip_attachment: type: OS::Nova::FloatingIPAssociation condition: 'for_prod' properties: server_id: {get_resource: server} floating_ip: {get_resource: floating_ip} outputs: floating_ip: value: {get_resource: floating_ip} condition: 'for_prod' As template above only if in 'prod' environment, we create a floating ip and associate it to the server, and also give the output of floating ip. In 'teat' environment, we create the server only. By passing the parameter 'env_type' we can conditionally create resources for different context. 1. Add optional section Conditions/conditions for cfn/hot template. In this section we define the conditions map, something like:: conditions: { condition_name1: {Intrinsic function}, condition_name2: {Intrinsic function}, condition_name3: {Intrinsic function} } 2. Implement related condition intrinsic functions, such as equals/not/and/or/if: equals: [value1, value2] not: [{condition}] and: [{condition1}, {condition2}, {...}] or: [{condition1}, {condition2}, {...}] if: [condition_name, value_if_true, value_if_false] Notes: the details we can see the aws doc: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/intrinsic-function-reference-conditions.html 3. Add optional section Condition/condition in resource/outputs section for cfn/hot template. The value of the Condition/condition should be condition_name which defined in 'conditions' map. If the condition result is True, the resource/output will be created, otherwise the resource/output will be ignored. Alternatives ------------ None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: huangtianhua@huawei.com Milestones ---------- mitaka-2 Work Items ---------- 1. Implement condition intrinsic functions. 2. Add Conditions/conditions map define for cfn/hot template. 3. Implement conditionally create resource with condition. 4. Implement conditionally given output with condition. 5. Add related tests. Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
carbonara: make sure we hearbeat our coordination driver

This never has been problem so far since most operation use a driver
with no heartbeat and are pretty short, but we never know.

Change-Id: I4862ed8c8b8d329f0b648807cbaf009f7024abaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/05/279405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright © 2016 Red Hat, Inc.import threading import time self.heartbeater = threading.Thread(target=self._heartbeat, name='heartbeat') self.heartbeater.setDaemon(True) self.heartbeater.start() def _heartbeat(self): while True: # FIXME(jd) Why 10? Why not. We should have a way to find out # what's the best value here, but it depends on the timeout used by # the driver; tooz should help us here! time.sleep(10) self.coord.heartbeat()

commit_message:
Switch to external noop tests

* Use external noop tests library and fixtures
* Corrections and fixes for the spec library to make it work

Partial blueprint: deployment-data-dryrun
Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: Ie8d1f80bbee04b9bacb43ba4fa39a423624a8301
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/16/276816/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_file '/etc/hiera/globals.yaml' } it 'should save the globals yaml file', :if => ENV['SPEC_UPDATE_GLOBALS'] do globals_yaml_content = task.resource_parameter_value self, 'file', '/etc/hiera/globals.yaml', 'content' task.write_file_globals globals_yaml_content
deleted_lines: it { should contain_file '/etc/hiera/globals.yaml' } it 'should save the globals yaml file' do globals_yaml_content = Noop.resource_parameter_value self, 'file', '/etc/hiera/globals.yaml', 'content' globals_yaml_path = Noop.globals_yaml_path globals_yaml_folder = Noop.hiera_globals_folder_path Dir.mkdir globals_yaml_folder unless File.directory? globals_yaml_folder File.open(globals_yaml_path, 'w') { |file| file.write globals_yaml_content } puts "Globals yaml saved to: '#{globals_yaml_path}'" if ENV['SPEC_PUPPET_DEBUG']

commit_message:
Increase timeouts to 800 sec for ha service checks

Sometimes after destructive action 600 sec is not enaugh,
so set timeouts to 800 sec, to be sure that we are not
affected by slow environments

Change-Id: Ifcd59cedf2a38c40d9f73d4e509c1b2c4d2d66bc
Closes-Bug: #1544958
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/09/281709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from fuelweb_test.helpers.utils import TimeStat with TimeStat("ha_ostf_after_revert", is_uniq=True): self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=800) with TimeStat("ha_ostf_after_slave_rabbit_destroy", is_uniq=True): self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready( cluster_id, timeout=800, should_fail=1) with TimeStat("ha_ostf_after_rabbit_slave_power_on", is_uniq=True): self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=800) with TimeStat("ha_ostf_master_rabbit_destroy", is_uniq=True): self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready( cluster_id, timeout=800, should_fail=1) with TimeStat("ha_ostf_master_rabbit_power_on", is_uniq=True): self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=800)
deleted_lines: self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=300) self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=600, should_fail=1) self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=600) self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=600, should_fail=1) self.fuel_web.assert_ha_services_ready(cluster_id, timeout=600)

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. class ProtectableRegistry(object): _protectable_map = {} @classmethod def load_plugins(cls, conf): """Load all protectable plugins configured and register them. :param conf: The plugin list to load. """ pass @classmethod def list_resource_types(cls): """List all resource types supported by protectables. :return: The list of supported resource types. """ pass @classmethod def list_resources(cls, resource_type): """List resource instances of given type. :param resource_type: The resource type to list instance. :return: The list of resource instance.
